list_definition.definition: to cut away (hair) from (usually oneself) with a razor

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He only shaves once a week.

list_definition.definition: (sometimes with off) to scrape or cut away (the surface of wood etc)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The joiner shaved a thin strip off the edge of the door.

list_definition.definition: (the result of) an act of shaving

list_ex_of_english: I am sure that the majority of housewives are not purchasing shaving soap for other purposes.
Personal hygiene, including tasks such as washing, shaving, applying make up, or simply scratching an itch.
The people to prosecute are the people who tempt the barber, and come in with large fees to get shaved.
I know of no foundation for the statement that prisoners are not provided with facilities for washing and shaving.
We considered shaving that off but decided that it would be better to leave the levels as they are.
The skin was shaved and an incision measuring 1 cm long was made through the skin and body wall.
If the men objected to shaving their moustaches, they are at liberty to discontinue the use of the razor altogether.
I thought he was going to say that the fourth was when he looked in the mirror in the morning when he shaves.
